inclusion.criterion: primary place of residence in one of the pre-selected recruitment census tracts
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: diagnosis of asthma made by a clinician >1 year prior to recruitment
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: at least 2 asthma exacerbations in the prior year
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: asthma controller medication at Visit 0 according to the MEDS program
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: parent/legal guardian is willing to sign the written informed consent
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: participant is willing to sign the assent form as per central Institutional Review Board (IRB) guidelines
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: has some form of insurance that covers costs of usual care asthma control and rescue medications at Visit 0
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: currently receiving treatment with anti-immunoglobulin E (anti-IgE) therapy or have had anti-IgE therapy in the previous 3 months prior to screening
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: clinically significant abnormalities on complete blood count (CBC) with differential as determined by the site study clinician
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: treated with systemic corticosteroids for any medical condition including an asthma exacerbation within the 2 weeks prior to Visit 0
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: had a cold in the previous 7 days
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient has a history of asthma and is currently using inhaled corticosteroid (ICS) and fluticasone 500 mcg/salmeterol 50 mcg. However, they have recently doubled their oral corticosteroids, which may indicate an exacerbation.
